docs.lead_paragraph: The state of Texas on Wednesday urged the U.S. Supreme Court to uphold its restrictions on abortion providers, citing the case of a Philadelphia doctor convicted in 2013 of murdering babies at his abortion clinic.

headline.main: Texas Urges Supreme Court to Uphold Abortion Law
headline.print_headline: Texas Urges Supreme Court to Uphold Abortion Law

docs.snippet: The state of Texas on Wednesday urged the U.S. Supreme Court to uphold its restrictions on abortion providers, citing the case of a Philadelphia doctor convicted in 2013 of murdering babies at his abortion clinic.

docs.lead_paragraph: A South African mayor defended on Wednesday her offer of bursaries for education to young women who remain virgins, saying it would help reduce teenage pregnancy and the spread of HIV/Aids as well as widening their job opportunities.

headline.main: South African Mayor Defends Controversial Virgin Bursary Scheme
headline.print_headline: South African Mayor Defends Controversial Virgin Bursary Scheme

docs.snippet: A South African mayor defended on Wednesday her offer of bursaries for education to young women who remain virgins, saying it would help reduce teenage pregnancy and the spread of HIV/Aids as well as widening their job opportunities.

docs.lead_paragraph: Liverpool beat visiting Stoke on penalty kicks.
docs.abstract: Liverpool reaches English League Cup final, beating Stoke, 6-5, on penalty kicks; other soccer news noted.

docs.lead_paragraph: A range of birth defects, not just small heads, may be linked to infection with the virus, federal health officials said on Tuesday.

headline.main: Zika Testing Is Urged for Some Newborns
headline.print_headline: Zika Testing Is Urged for Some Newborns

docs.abstract: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention officials say newborns should be tested for mosquito-borne Zika virus if their mothers visited or lived in any country experiencing outbreak and have reported symptoms of Zika virus infection; virus can be linked to defects in vision and hearing, among other abnormalities.
docs.snippet: A range of birth defects, not just small heads, may be linked to infection with the virus, federal health officials said on Tuesday.

keywords.value: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
keywords.name: organizations

docs.lead_paragraph: The recommendation is expected to galvanize many more health providers to provide screening for women during pregnancy and after giving birth.

headline.main: Panel Calls for Depression Screenings During and After Pregnancy
headline.print_headline: Panel Urges Screening for Maternal Depression

docs.abstract: Government-appointed panel recommends depression screening for women both during pregnancy and after birth, first time it has advocated evaluation for maternal mental illness; endorsement follows studies showing so-called postpartum depression is more common and begins earlier than previously thought, often taking hold during pregnancy; recommendation, published in JAMA, is given 'B' rating, which requires that it be covered under Affordable Care Act.
docs.snippet: The recommendation is expected to galvanize many more health providers to provide screening for women during pregnancy and after giving birth.

keywords.value: United States Preventive Services Task Force
keywords.name: organizations

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject

docs.lead_paragraph: A federal judge on Tuesday found unconstitutional a 2014 law that imposed tough restrictions on Louisiana abortion providers and threatened to close four of the state's five clinics.

headline.main: U.S. Judge Rules Against Louisiana Abortion Restrictions
headline.print_headline: U.S. Judge Rules Against Louisiana Abortion Restrictions

docs.snippet: A federal judge on Tuesday found unconstitutional a 2014 law that imposed tough restrictions on Louisiana abortion providers and threatened to close four of the state's five clinics.

docs.lead_paragraph: The number of countries and territories in the Americas reporting cases of the mosquito-borne Zika virus rose to 22 on Tuesday, more than double the number a month ago, according to the Pan American Health Organization (PAHO).

headline.main: Factbox: 12 Facts About the Zika Virus as Outbreak Spreads in the Americas
headline.print_headline: Factbox: 12 Facts About the Zika Virus as Outbreak Spreads in the Americas

docs.snippet: The number of countries and territories in the Americas reporting cases of the mosquito-borne Zika virus rose to 22 on Tuesday, more than double the number a month ago, according to the Pan American Health Organization (PAHO).

docs.lead_paragraph: President Barack Obama on Tuesday called for the rapid development of tests, vaccines and treatments to fight the mosquito-transmitted Zika virus, which has been linked to birth defects and could spread to the United States in warmer months.

headline.main: Obama Calls for Rapid Zika Research as Virus Seen Spreading
headline.print_headline: Obama Calls for Rapid Zika Research as Virus Seen Spreading

docs.snippet: President Barack Obama on Tuesday called for the rapid development of tests, vaccines and treatments to fight the mosquito-transmitted Zika virus, which has been linked to birth defects and could spread to the United States in warmer months.
